title: Executive Order 7970-Regulations Governing the Grades and Ratings of Enlisted Men of the Regular Army for the Fiscal Year 1939
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 20, 1936, 49 Stat. 1554, it is ordered that during the fiscal year 1939 the grades and ratings of the enlisted men of the Regular Army shall be as set forth herein, and that the number of enlisted men in the several grades and ratings shall not exceed the number specified herein.
1. The several grades and the maximum number of enlisted men therein shall be as follows:
2. Specialists ratings and the maximum number of enlisted men therein shall be as follows:
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7970-Regulations Governing the Grades and Ratings of Enlisted Men of the Regular Army for the Fiscal Year 1939 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368787
